summary: Internal FBI email chain from September 2021 discussing a request for communications between Victim Specialists (VS) and victims/witnesses/attorneys involved in the Epstein/Maxwell investigation. The emails coordinate how to formally request information from specific VS personnel, referencing a case number and involving the FBI's Victim Services Division and OGC/HCt.

persons.name: Program Manager
persons.role: Program Manager, Victim Program Management Unit
persons.context: FBI employee in the Victim Services Division who is coordinating the request for communications from Victim Specialists involved in the Epstein/Maxwell case, offering to ensure VS adherence.

events.title: FBI Internal Request for VS Communications
events.description: Internal FBI emails discuss submitting a formal request to obtain all communications (emails, text messages) that Victim Specialists have had with victims, witnesses, or victims' attorneys related to the Epstein/Maxwell investigation.

keyFacts: The FBI's Victim Services Division is actively seeking communications between its Victim Specialists and parties involved in the Epstein/Maxwell case as of September 2021.
The request has a specific case number: SOD-NY-3027571.
The coordination involves the FBI's Office of the General Counsel (OGC/HCt), indicating legal oversight of the request.
The document is an internal procedural email about evidence gathering, not a transcript or record of the communications themselves.
The scope of the request includes communications from New Mexico, suggesting investigative interest in activities or victims there.
